articles.title: Jordanian National Preparatory Committee Formed
articles.content:
Jordanian National Preparatory Committee Formed 
    Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- A Jordanian national preparatory committee for celebrating February 16, the birthday of leader Kim Jong  Il, was inaugurated in Amman on January 30.
 Marwan Sudah, chairman of the Arabic Committee for Solidarity with the Korean People and Supporting Korea's Reunification in Jordan, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.    
 The committee decided to organize colorful functions such as rally, seminar, lecture and photo exhibition to widely introduce the leadership exploits of Kim Jong Il on the occasion of the February holiday.

Military Attache of Egyptian Embassy Gives Reception
articles.content:
Military Attache of Egyptian Embassy Gives Reception
     Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- Mahmoud Mohamed Osman Atik, military attache of the Egyptian embassy here, gave a reception on the evening of Feb. 10 on the occasion of the birthday of leader Kim Jong Il.
 Invited there were generals and officers of the Korean People's Army.    
 Speeches were made there.

articles.title: More Gifts to Kim Jong Il Exhibited
Floral Basket and Congratulatory Letter to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Basket and Congratulatory Letter to Kim Jong Il
    Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il received a floral basket and a congratulatory letter from the diplomatic corps here on the occasion of his birthday.
 They were conveyed to Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun today by Palestinian Ambassador e.p. to the DPRK Shaher Mohammed Abdlah who is doyen of the corps.

articles.title: Floral Basket to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Basket to Kim Jong Il
    Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il received a floral basket from Yasser Arafat, president of Palestine, on the occasion of his birthday.
 The floral basket was handed today to Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun by Palestinian Ambassador E.P. to the DPRK Shaher Mohammed Abdlah. .
